author: timhc22
content:
hey <@!301186049323958275>, thanks for the recommendation to get in touch in here. 
<@!191378736254287874> or <@!552133098075193354> you may be best for answering this..

During the EEA conference last Friday, it was mentioned that "It would be good if there was a way for Enterprises to be able to submit EIP ideas"... (congrats on your talk by the way <@!552133098075193354>, looks like you had a lot of interest judging by how busy the breakout room was!)

Following this, I decided to build an MVP/POC web app: https://eip.design (https://github.com/unegma/eip.design) meant as a high level 'feedback' tool, the 'ideas' from which can then be refined and submitted as actual 'correct format' EIPs (if they are deemed worthy).

If this seems like an interesting idea, I will continue developing it, <@!191378736254287874> this may be one that Baseline protocol would be interested in. Any other ideas or suggestions or feedback much welcome.

author: timhc22
content: The backend currently just sends over a JSON response, however, I'm thinking of developing it to spit out the data in the correct .md format for an eip pull request

author: timhc22
content: I was thinking that the target audience might be CTOs (or 'blockchain lead') roles within larger organisations, who will have heard and understood business requirements from those building on Ethereum (at the business level), and will then have translated those ideas into something which could be used to develop the protocol layer.

author: timhc22
content: congrats on the new role as well by the way <@!552133098075193354>

author: hudsonjameson
content: Awesome work <@!597792256837156971>! I think enterprises getting involved in the EIP process and submitting is great, but in my experience there is a knowledge gap with enterprise CTOs and tech leads in businesses about what an EIP is and what belongs in an EIP, which it sounds like you are trying to fix. We haven't done a great job making EIP making easy to understand or making the EIP process understandable. The best way you can help is to have a section on your site that explains, in a tech business person's language, what does and doesn't belong in an EIP.

author: timbeiko
content: You should ping <@!574864862338088960>: he wrote 5-6 EIPs a while back and built a tool to automate part of the process. I wonder if you could integrate it? IIRC, he may have shared it in this channel too.

author: timhc22
content: oh sweet! yes would love to have more of a chat <@!574864862338088960>

author: timbeiko
content: +1 to all that. Also, an easy way for folks to get involved is just to open up ethereum-magicians.org regularly, read what's being proposed there and comment on how it would be good/bad for their use cases üëç
